articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Establishments in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Establishments in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to light industrial establishments in Pyongyang.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the newly-built Taedonggang Foodstuff Factory.
					
					After being briefed on the factory in front of a huge map showing its panoramic view, he went round its interior and exterior to acquaint himself in detail with its construction and production there.
					
					One can clearly notice noble patriotism of soldier-builders and their spirit of devoted service for the people wherever one goes at the factory, he said, highly appreciating the feats they performed by building the modern factory which would win the admiration of even posterity. 
					
					Noting that the factory has an important role to play in improving the diet of the people, he set forth important tasks to be fulfilled by the factory.
					
					It is the unshakable determination and goal of the Party to provide the best living conditions to the people who will live in the great prosperous and powerful nation, he said, underscoring the need for the factory to increase the production of quality foodstuffs helpful to improving the diet of the people.
					
					Saying that the Korean people's long-cherished great ideals and desires are now being translated into reality one after another thanks to the dynamic  advance for effecting a great surge, he earnestly called for making uninterrupted advance and steady innovation, confident of victory, and thus bringing earlier a rosy future of a thriving nation.
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Pyongyang Textile Machine Plant.
					
					 He went round the room for the education in the revolutionary history and the room devoted to the history of the plant.
					
					 Recollecting with deep emotion the unforgettable days when he worked together with workers there nearly 50 years ago, he showed boundless loving care and benevolence for them, inquiring after the health of everyone of those with whom he got acquainted at the work site.
					
					 Then, he went round various production processes in full capacity operation and compound clad in foliage of trees of various species to learn in detail about progress made in the modernization of the plant and production there.
					
					 After acquainting himself in detail with the performance, mechanism and principles of operation of newly-invented and manufactured looms, he expressed his great satisfaction over the fact that the workers of the plant have made excellent looms as required by the IT era with all their wisdom and zeal and sent them to textile mills. And he highly appreciated their feats.
					
					 He met with the persons of merit who have made great contributions to the strengthening and development of the plant while working there for years and gave a pep talk to them before posing for a picture with them.
					
					 Saying that the plant has an important role to play in developing the nation's textile industry, he advanced highly important tasks to be carried out by it.
					
					 He was accompanied by Secretary Kim Ki Nam and Department Directors Kim Kyong Hui and Pak Nam Gi of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Meets Participants of Meeting of Non-Commissioned Officers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Meets Participants of Meeting of Non-Commissioned Officers
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il met the participants in the national meeting of active non-commissioned officers of the KPA in extra service now under way in Pyongyang and wished them success in the meeting. 
					 He had a photo session with them.
					
					 He highly praised the feats of the KPA non-commissioned officers in extra service, saying that they are the persons of faith and conscience as they have believed in and followed the idea and intention of their leader, their supreme commander only with white gem-like pure minds, not seeking any honor and post, the true patriots who are thinking of the interests of the country and the revolution before doing of comfort of themselves and their families and the treasures of the WPK and the KPA as they have rendered great services for increasing the combat capability with their high combat and technical skills and abilities.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and conviction that they would devotedly work at the sacred posts defending the country with patriotic zeal and thus make a positive contribution to accomplishing the cause of building a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation and winning a final victory in the Korean revolution.
					
					 Present on the occasion were KPA Vice Marshal Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and minister of the People's Armed Forces, KPA General Kim Jong Gak, member of the NDC of the DPRK and first deputy director of the KPA General Political Bureau, KPA General Ri Yong Ho, chief of the KPA General Staff, KPA Generals Kim Won Hong, Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and other commanding officers of the army.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Botswana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Botswana
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Seretse Khama Ian Khama, President of Botswana, on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relationship between the two countries would grow stronger as the days go by, Kim in the message wished the president and people of Botswana greater successes in the work for social and economic development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Congratulates PM of Albania
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Congratulates PM of Albania
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Sali Berisha upon his stay in office as Albanian Prime Minister.
					The message wished him success in his work for the development of the country and well-being of the people.
					
					On the same day DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to Ilir Meta upon his appointment as deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Albania.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Arrive
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Arrive
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Women's International Democratic Federation led by its President Marcia de Campos Pereira arrived here today.
					 Also arriving were Naguib Sawiris, chairman and CEO of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt, and his party.

articles.title: Chinese Exhibition of Oil Paintings Opens
articles.content:
Chinese Exhibition of Oil Paintings Opens
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A Chinese exhibition of oil paintings was opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Tuesday to mark the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the People's Republic of China.
					On display there are more than 60 oil paintings created by famous Chinese artists.
					
					Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, in his opening address said that the exhibition would provide Koreans with an opportunity to deepen the friendly feelings towards the Chinese people and know better about the successes achieved in the development of Chinese art.
					
					He stressed the need to actively develop the exchange between the two countries in culture and art to contribute to glorifying the history and tradition of the DPRK-China friendship in the future, too.
					
					Then, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming and the head of the delegation of Chinese painters in their speeches said that cultural exchange is playing a big role in promoting the mutual understanding between the peoples of the two countries and facilitating the sustained development of the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 Noting that the cultural exchange between the two countries has gained in width and depth over the last six decades since the opening of the bilateral diplomatic relations, they stressed that the current exhibition would help towards boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between China and the DPRK.
					
					 At the end of the opening ceremony, the participants looked round paintings on display.

articles.title: Reception Given on Diamond Jubilee of China
articles.content:
Reception Given on Diamond Jubilee of China
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association co-hosted a reception at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.
					Present there on invitation were Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, his embassy officials and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who doubles as chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and others.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Mongolian Embassy Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Mongolian Embassy Held
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with staff members of the Mongolian embassy here took place at the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Jongbang Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province on Tuesday.
					Present there on invitation were Ambassador Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar and staff members of the Mongolian embassy and Mongolian guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					The participants in the meeting talked to one another about the need to boost the cooperative relations between the two countries and sang songs, deepening the friendship.
					
					Prior to the meeting, the guests went round various places of the farm and handed their aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Seminar Held to Mark 10th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
articles.content:
Seminar Held to Mark 10th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A seminar in the field of youth affairs was held at the Central Youth Hall on Monday to mark the 10th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary
					 Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Further Enhance the Role of the Primary Organizations of the Youth League".
					 The letter Kim Jong Il sent to the participants of the meeting of the exemplary officials of primary organizations of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League on Sept. 29, Juche 88 (1999) clearly indicates the tasks to be fulfilled by the primary organizations of the youth league as required by the revolutionary development which has entered a new higher stage in building a great prosperous and powerful nation and ways to do so.
					
					 Many papers were presented at the seminar.
					
					 The speakers stressed that the work serves as a powerful engine helping the youth perform their honorable mission they have assumed before the era and the revolution.
					
					 Devotedly defending the leader is the most vivid expression of loyalty to the party and the leader and provides a sure guarantee for protecting and glorifying the destiny of the party and revolution, the country and its people, they said, calling on the organizations of the youth league to direct primary efforts to this work.
					
					 Referring to the fact that the validity and vitality of the idea put forth in the work have been clearly proved over the last decade, they went on:
					
					 The officials of the youth league should eternally glorify the idea of the youth movement and immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, deeply grasp the ideas and theories set forth in the work and bring about a revolutionary turn in the work of the league and thus firmly prepare all the young people as reliable young vanguard of the party, first-line standard-bearers taking the lead in opening the gate to a thriving nation and heroes of the era.

articles.title: 21st Symposium on Yun I Sang Music Held
articles.content:
21st Symposium on Yun I Sang Music Held
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The 21st symposium on Yun I Sang music was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday. 
					Present at the symposium were Kim Pyong Hun, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature of Korea, Song Sok Hwan, vice-minister of Culture, officials concerned, creators and artistes of national art organizations and teachers and researchers in the field of art education. 
					
					Yun's daughter was present there. 
					
					The symposium heard speeches titled "On applying the traditional national music rhythm of Korea in Yun I Sang music", "On the themes of concertos of Yun I Sang", "On Yun I Sang's creation of music in the early period of his activities" and "On Yun I Sang's Symphony No. 1." 
					
					Speakers scientifically and theoretically proved the ideas and contents and national character and rendition technical features of the musical works composed by composer Yun, produced by the Korean nation, who made a contribution to developing human music. They spoke highly of the career of Yun who dedicated himself to the reconciliation and unity of the nation and the country's reunification and his creative activities. 
					
					 The symposium provided an opportunity of making a wider-ranging and more profound study of the music of Yun who left big traces in the world history of modern music for the national character, philosophy and appeal reflected in his works.

articles.title: Symposium on Juche-based Idea of Literature and Art Held
articles.content:
Symposium on Juche-based Idea of Literature and Art Held
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A symposium of the Juche-based idea of literature and art on the feature film "The Country I Saw" (parts 2 and 3) took place Monday.
					Present there were Choe Ik Gyu, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Pyong Hun, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature of Korea, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of movie industry and teachers and researchers at universities.
					
					Speakers at the symposium said that the film chose the international position and significance of the Songun politics pursued by leader Kim Jong Il as its theme and explained it in depth. 
					
					Dealing with the pressing issue of the modern international politics an answer to which is called for by the world progressive conscience, the film explains through high artistic representation the philosophical truth that national independence is guaranteed by the might of the single-minded unity of the army and people around the leader and powerful military power and that Songun means independence, justice and victory, they noted.
					
					They also referred to the fact that the film actively introduced the latest science and technology, thus laying a springboard from which to make a new leaping advance in the efforts to put the nation's level of movie production onto a higher stage.
					
					They recalled that creators and artistes properly chose the seed as required by the basic principle for creating Korean-style revolutionary literature and art and effected signal innovations in the movie production by waging a drive day and night in the collectivist spirit. 
					
					They called upon all creators and artistes to draw on the achievements and experience gained in the production of the film and create more masterpieces of the era which will encourage the servicepersons and people in their drive to effect a new great revolutionary surge.

articles.title: Pyongyang Han Tok Su Univ. of Light Industry in Its Golden Jubilee
articles.content:
Pyongyang Han Tok Su Univ. of Light Industry in Its Golden Jubilee
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry located in east Pyongyang greets its 50th birthday this year.
					Since its foundation (September 1959), it has solved many scientific and technological problems arising in improving people's living, making a great contribution to the development of the light industry.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung picked up the site for the university after the Korean war and indicated orientation and ways for its development.
					
					The lofty intention of the President has come true amid the warm care of General Secretary
						Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He saw to it that measures were taken to strengthen scientific and educational work of the university and sent a lot of necessary modern facilities to it.
					
					Teachers and researchers of the university have forcefully pushed ahead with scientific researches and thus greatly contributed to technological updating, normalization of production and raising of quality at light industrial factories.
					
					In recent years they have solved technological problems arising in designing and manufacturing machines for modern general foodstuff factories being constructed in each province, established a new production system of soybean sauce and bean-paste and completed the method of appraising the quality of cosmetics so as to turn out more quality cosmetics. 
					
					The researchers of the information centre of the university completed a three-dimensional garment design program to ensure the scientific accuracy and quality on the highest level in garment designs. The program is paying off profusely at clothing factories.
					
					 All the successes of the university are attributable to the great concern of the peerlessly great men paid to the scientific and educational work to  develop the light industry of the country.
					
					 The graduates of the university are playing a great role in state economic institutions and industrial establishments.

articles.title: Peculiar Floor Jewel Mosaic
articles.content:
Peculiar Floor Jewel Mosaic
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The floor jewel mosaic made in the DPRK is well known to the world for its beautiful color, peculiar luster and high formative influence of patterns.
					 The floor jewel mosaic, called "jewel carpet" in the DPRK, strikes the viewers with great admiration.
					
					 Especially the subdued depth, vividness and three-dimensional character of the flower pattern have a formative effect unprecedented in the long history of the floor mosaic development.
					
					 The floor mosaic, which depicts the various flowers including camellia, broad bellflower and peach blossom closely related with the life of the Korean people with various colors of jewel pieces, gives fresh feelings to people as if they were in a flower bed.
					
					Such floor mosaics are found in the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, the Changgwang Health Complex, the Mansudae Art Theatre, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace and other monumental buildings.
					
					 The floor mosaic in the DPRK was switched to the form of multilayer structure floor mosaic in the beginning of the 2000s, which makes it possible to reduce the amount of jewel and to ensure the artistic expression to the full.
					
					 The floor mosaic is ever developing as part of the architectural decorative art in the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. Policy for New Cold War under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Policy for New Cold War under Fire
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. National Intelligence Agency recently announced its "2009 national intelligence strategy" which labeled the DPRK, China, Russia and Iran as hostile countries capable of challenging the U.S interests, setting out priorities for the nation's intelligence agencies to intensify collecting information on those countries and eradicate "threat" from them.
					 In this regard Minju Joson Tuesday runs a signed commentary which says:
					
					It hinted that the present U.S. administration would pursue the hostile policy toward the DPRK, China, Russia and Iran, regarding them as foes of the U.S. in political and military aspects in the future.
					
					In the "2009 national intelligence strategy" the U.S. listed the DPRK as a "dangerous country" threatening security of the U.S. and called for "eradication of capabilities." This cannot but be called into question.
					
					 The DPRK "program on weapons of mass destruction", much touted by the U.S., is nothing but a fabrication invented to realize its hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					Nevertheless, the U.S. is taking issue with the DPRK, calling it a "dangerous country" posing threat to the U.S. security, in a bid to attain its ulterior political aims.
					
					 Of late the U.S. has repeatedly talked about "threat" from countries in the Far East. This is because it is much interested in the strategic hegemony over the region rather than feels any threat to its security.
					
					 The U.S. Asia strategy may be expressed as policy for new Cold War, in a word.
					
					The military strength is not a monopoly of the U.S., and it will only lead the U.S. to further international isolation and destruction.
					
					 The U.S. should at once give up its foolish scheme to turn back history with the anachronistic Cold War policy.

articles.title: S.Korean Ultra-Right Conservative Forces' Bellicose Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Ultra-Right Conservative Forces' Bellicose Remarks under Fire
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Thae Yong, new minister of Defence of south Korea, at a recent "confirmation hearing at the National Assembly," blustered that "it is possible to mount a preemptive attack on the north's arsenal of nuclear weapons."
					Commenting on this, a news analyst of Minju Joson Tuesday observes that it is a blatant military provocation to the DPRK.
					
					Recalling that at a "confirmation hearing" held last year this guy touted the "theory of a preemptive attack on a nuclear base in the north" before holding the post of chairman of the joint chiefs of staff, the news analyst notes that he made bluffing, trumpeting about the said theory this time again.
					
					This only laid bare his bellicose nature as a war maniac hell-bent on confrontation with fellow countrymen, the news analyst says, and continues:
					
					Last year the inter-Korean relations were brought back to the relations of distrust and confrontation before the publication of the June 15 joint declaration because the south Korean conservative forces pursued confrontation with compatriots after their seizure of power, negating the inter-Korean declarations. Kim Thae Yong is known to have played a very bad role in this deplorable development. 
					
					What Kim uttered compels the public to express apprehension as to the future of the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					Kim could assume the post of minister of Defence as the "National Assembly" overlooked the above-said outbursts let loose by him.
					
					Ri Sang Ui, when speaking at a "confirmation hearing" as chairman-designate of the joint chiefs of staff, cried out for "making a preemptive strike at the north's nuclear base" and raved that "he had a plan for a precise and rapid attack on it."
					
					All facts go to prove that the ultra-right conservative forces of south Korea are pursuing confrontation with fellow countrymen, still obsessed by the idea of confrontation dating back to the era of the Cold War. There is no knowing when they will torpedo the process of the inter-Korean relations which have been put on the orbit of normalization with so much effort. 
					
					The inter-Korean relations can never be improved by the efforts of one party alone. The prospect of improving the inter-Korean relations entirely depends on the stand and attitude of the south side.

articles.title: World Maritime Day Observed
articles.content:
World Maritime Day Observed
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dedicates a signed article to World Maritime Day.
					The daily in the article says that the theme of World Maritime Day this year is "Climatic change: A challenge for IMO, too," adding that the climatic changes caused by global warming are adversely affecting the human life and the socio-economic development. They are causing a lot of countries of the world to suffer natural calamities due to heat waves and draught, torrential rain and flood, etc., the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The DPRK joined the IMO in April 1986.
					
					Vigorous endeavors are being made to ensure maritime safety and prevent sea pollution, etc. under the care of the Party and government of the DPRK where such popular policies as regarding the people's lives as the most precious ones are enforced.
					
					In connection with the IMO's enforcement of the system for discerning and tracking ships sailing from far away from July 1, the DPRK set up a control center for ships and put it into operation. 
					
					The DPRK also acceded to the "International Convention on Civil Liability for Oil Pollution Damage 2001," prompted by the desire to protect the sea environment. 
					
					A work is now brisk worldwide to ensure maritime security and prevent sea pollution on the occasion of the above-said day.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- All the Koreans at home and abroad are called upon to cherish the faith that there is nothing impossible when they struggle in the idea of "By our nation itself" and intensify the movement for national reunification under the uplifted banner of it. 
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a signed article.
					
					It goes on:
					
					The idea of "By our nation itself" is instilling strong desire for reunification and patriotism into the Koreans. 
					
					The above-said idea has displayed great vitality by imbuing all the Koreans ardently desiring the country's reunification with strong will and energy to achieve it without fail in the spirit of independence and unity, rejecting outside forces. The signal successes made in the movement for the country's reunification in the June 15 era of reunification are the shining fruition of the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					The June 15 joint declaration has commanded warm support and approval from all the Koreans for its patriotic nature and truth of the above-mentioned idea, its basic spirit, and its exceptionally great attraction. 
					
					The prevailing situation urgently calls on the Koreans to unite closer than ever before and pool efforts to bring about a fresh phase in the development of the movement for national reunification.
					
					All the Koreans should deeply grasp the validity of the above-said idea and carry on a vigorous struggle for firmly preserving and thoroughly implementing the June 15 joint declaration. This is the only way of establishing the sovereignty of the nation and achieving peace, reunification and prosperity of the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Remembered in Ukraine and Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Remembered in Ukraine and Peru
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held in Ukraine and Peru on Sept. 22 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese heroine and woman commander of Mt. Paektu.
					 Introduced at the meetings were the part of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century" dealing with the revolutionary career of Kim Jong Suk and the short biography of her revolutionary activities. Then speeches were made.
					
					Nikolai Polishk, chairman of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Jong Suk is a bodyguard who defended Kim Il Sung at the risk of her life during the anti-Japanese armed struggle and in the period of building a new Korea after its liberation.
					
					She is a genuine revolutionary who resolutely advocated the revolutionary idea and line of the President under the complicated situation and an indomitable fighter who left brilliant records in the history of the world women's liberation movement, the speaker said, adding: She is the great mother of the revolution as she gave steady continuity to the Korean revolution.
					
					The widow of Angel Castro Lavarello, former president of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship, said that Kim Jong Suk embarked on the road of revolution in her early years, putting the revolution before herself and established her fame as a heroine ready to unhesitatingly dedicate her life to the revolution.
					
					The greatest exploit of Kim Jong Suk is that she gave birth to General Secretary Kim Jong Il, lodestar of Mt. Paektu, and brought him up as the successor to Kim Il Sung, she said, adding: Her life was that for the revolution and serves as a vivid example telling that there is no end to the mental and moral life of a revolutionary though his or her physical life is limited.

articles.title: DPRK Birthday Marked in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Birthday Marked in Various Countries
Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibitions were held in Russia, Mexico, Peru and Mongolia from Sept. 4 to 28 on the occasion of the 61st birthday of the DPRK.
					Displayed in the venues of the functions were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos on their undying exploits, books and photos showing the true picture of Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with wisdom and talents of the Korean people.
					
					Speeches were made at their opening ceremonies.
					
					The director of the Department for the International, Overseas Economic and Inter-regional Relations of the Nidjegorod Regional Administration of Russia stressed that the DPRK is proudly demonstrating its dignity in the international arena with its strong defence capability, adding that the exhibition would provide an opportunity to get deeper understanding of it.
					
					The governor of a district of Mexico and the acting governor of a district of Peru said that they extend firm solidarity to the Korean people standing against the U.S. imperialists and struggling to defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve national reunification.
					
					They also stressed that through exhibitions, the peoples of their countries would get good understanding of the brilliant culture of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige fabricas de rama de industria ligera
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige fabricas de rama de industria ligera
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno las fabricas de la rama de industria ligera en esta capital.
					Primeramente, el Dirigente estuvo en la Fabrica de Alimentos de Taedonggang nuevamente construida.
					
					Al escuchar las explicaciones ante el plano de la fabrica, recorrio el interior y el exterior de la empresa e hizo conocimiento detallado del estado de construccion y de la produccion.
					
					Senalo que en todas partes de la planta es posible sentir con carne propia el noble patriotismo de los constructores militares y su espiritu de servicio abnegado al pueblo y evaluo altamente los meritos de ellos quienes edificaron la moderna fabrica que no se quedara a la zaga tambien en el futuro lejano.
					
					Apunto que la Fabrica de Alimentos de Taedonggang ocupa el importante lugar en la mejora de la vida alimentaria del pueblo e indico las tareas programaticas que se presentan ante la fabrica.
					
					Destaco que el PTC tiene la firme decision y la meta de ofrecer las mas magnificas condiciones de vida al pueblo que vivira en la gran potencia prospera y anadio que la fabrica debe producir gran cantidad de alimentos de buena calidad que contribuiran a la mejora de la vida alimentaria del pueblo.
					
					Enfatizo que en la marcha de gran auge se realizan uno tras otro el gran ideal y aspiracion que abrigaba durante mucho tiempo nuestro pueblo y exhorto encarecidamente a adelantar lo mas pronto posible el brillante futuro de la gran potencia prospera al seguir avanzando y registrando innovaciones con la fe en la victoria.
					
					A continuacion, el Dirigente dirigio sobre el terreno la Fabrica de Maquinas Textiles de Pyongyang.
					
					 Recorrio la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la de presentacion del historial.
					
					 Recordo con emocion los inolvidables dias de hace ahora casi 50 anos cuando trabajaba con los obreros en esta fabrica y dispenso el infinito amor y benevolencia preguntandoles las noticias de los obreros familiarizados en el terreno.
					
					 Al recorrer varios procesos de produccion en que reina el sonido de las maquinas en pleno funcionamiento y el recinto de la fabrica cubierto de los arboles de varios generos, se entero detalladamente del progreso de la modernizacion y el estado de produccion.
					
					 Al cerciorarse minuciosamente de la facultad, estructura y principios de funcionamiento de los telares nuevamente inventados, expreso una gran satisfaccion de que los obreros de la fabrica producen con toda su inteligencia y entusiasmo los excelentes telares convenientes a la epoca de la industria de informatica y los envian a las fabricas textiles y evaluo altamente sus meritos.
					
					Se reunio con los benemeritos quienes trabajan durante largo tiempo en la fabrica y hacen gran aporte al desarrollo de la fabrica, los estimulo cordialmente y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					 El Dirigente dijo que esta fabrica ocupa el lugar importante en desarrollar la industria textil del pais y presento las tareas programaticas que se presentan ante ella.
					
					El Dirigente fue acompanado por el secretario del CC del PTC Kim Ki Nam y los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC Kim Kyong Hui y Pak Nam Gi.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il felicita a suboficiales en servicio de reenganche
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il felicita a suboficiales en servicio de reenganche
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del  Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional (CDN) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea (EPC), se reunio con los participantes en la Conferencia Nacional de los Activistas de los Suboficiales en Servicio de Reenganche que se efectua en esta capital y felicito los exitos de este foro.
					El Dirigente se fotografio junto a los participantes.
					
					El evaluo altamente las proezas de los suboficiales en servicio de reenganche de todo el ejercito diciendo que estos son los hombres con la conviccion y conciencia quienes confian y siguen con el alma de gema solo la idea y el proposito de su Lider y su Comandante Supremo sin perseguir cualquier honor y posicion, los patriotas que piensan primeramente en los intereses de la patria y la revolucion antes que la comodidad y placer individuales y familiares y los preciosos tesoros de nuestro partido y ejercito popular que hacen gran aporte al fortalecimiento de la combatividad con alta facultad combativa y tecnica y capacidad.
					
					Expreso la gran esperanza y conviccion de que al luchar abnegadamente en el sagrado puesto de la defensa de la patria con el fervor patriotico, ellos contribuiran activamente a realizar la causa de la construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista y lograr la victoria final de la revolucion coreana.
					
					En esta ocasion estuvieron presentes el vicemariscal del EPC Kim Yong Chun, vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares; el general de ejercito del EPC Kim Jong Gak, miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer subdirector de la Direccion Politica General del EPC; el general de ejercito del EPC Ri Yong Ho, jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC; los generales de ejercito del EPC Kim Won Hong, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su, y otros miembros de mando del ejercito.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena politica de nueva guerra fria de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena politica de nueva guerra fria de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ATCC) -- En el reciente "informe de estrategia de informacion estatal para 2009", la Agencia Nacional de Inteligencia de Estados Unidos definio a Corea, China, Rusia e Iran como paises hostiles capaces de desafiar a los intereses de ese imperio y enfatizo la necesidad de fortalecer las actividades de inteligencia sobre los paises correspondientes y adherir activamente a la eliminacion de la "amenaza".
					 Esto insinua que en el futuro la actual administracion norteamericana perseguira la politica hostil a esos paises tomandolos como enemigos en el dominio politico y militar.
					
					 Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 29 y continua:
					
					 No podemos pasar por alto el hecho de que en ese "informe" EE.UU. hablo de la supuesta "eliminacion de la capacidad" tildando a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea del "Estado peligroso" que "amenaza" la seguridad de su pais.
					
					 El "plan relativo con las armas de exterminio masivo" de la RPDC de que habla tanto EE.UU. no pasa de ser una invencion para realizar su politica hostil a esta.
					
					 Tal insistencia de ese pais americano parte del malsano objeto politico.
					
					En estos dias, el imperio suele decir supuesta "amenaza" de los paises situados en el Extremo Oriente, porque el no siente alguna amenaza sino tiene mayor interes en la heguemonia estrategica en esta region.
					
					 Es posible decir, en una palabra, que la estrategia de EE.UU. hacia Asia es, en fin de cuentas, la politica de nueva guerra fria.
					
					 La fuerza militar no es el monopolio de EE.UU. sino llevara mas este pais americano al aislamiento internacional y la derrota.
					
					 EE.UU. debe abandonar de inmediato su absurdo intento de virar al reves la historia mediante la anacronica politica de guerra fria.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena palabras belicosas de Kim Thae Yong
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena palabras belicosas de Kim Thae Yong
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El nuevo ministro de "Defensa Nacional" del Sur de Corea, Kim Thae Yong, en la "audiencia de la Asamblea Nacional para la confirmacion del nombramiento" efectuada antes de tomar su cargo, dijo que "es posible hacer el ataque preventivo" contra "el lugar de arsenal de las armas nucleares del Norte de Corea", lo cual es una abierta provocacion militar contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este martes y continua:
					
					Kim insistio en el intento de "dar golpe preventivo a la base nuclear del Norte de Corea" en la "audiencia de la Asamblea Nacional para la confirmacion del nombramiento" del ano pasado, con lo cual tomo el cargo de presidente de la "Junta de Jefes de Estado Mayor".
					
					Tambien esta vez, el repitio la misma teoria  mostrando la naturaleza de belicista enloquecido por la confrontacion fratricida.
					
					Las relaciones Norte-Sur que se desarrollaban favorablemente retrocedieron a partir del ano pasado en el estado de la desconfianza y confrontacion anterior a la epoca del 15 de junio, lo cual se debe a que las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas tomaron el poder y se entregaron a las maquinaciones de confrontacion fratricida negando las declaraciones conjuntas Norte-Sur.
					
					En relacion con tales palabras de Kim, no podemos menos de preocuparnos de la perspectiva de las relaciones Norte-Sur. 
					
					La "Asamblea Nacional" no cuestiono tal disparate de Kim, debido a lo cual este pudo tomar el cargo de ministro de "Defensa Nacional".
					
					Tambien Ri Sang Ui, quien se presento como candidato al presidente de la "Junta de Jefes de Estado Mayor" en la misma "audiencia", dijo que "tiene el plan de atacarle exacta y rapidamente"  repitiendo el "ataque preventivo a la base nuclear del Norte de Corea". 
					
					Todos los hechos muestran que presas de la antigua concepcion de confrontacion de la epoca de la guerra fria, las fuerzas conservadoras ultraderechistas del Sur de Corea persiguen invariablemente la confrontacion fratricida. 
					
					Las relaciones Norte-Sur no pueden mejorarse con los esfuerzos de una parte. La perspectiva de la mejora de las relaciones Norte-Sur depende enteramente de la posicion y la actitud de la parte surena.
